website_summaries.verdict: While it is likely to satisfy those who want to trim and edge small to medium yards, others on our shortlist are more powerful when it comes to more challenging trimming tasks.
pros: Basic and easy to use in a build that isn't very heavy
Comes with a battery and charger
Works as well at edging as it does trimming
Doesn't tend to vibrate and isn't very loud
Falls on the low end of the price range
cons: Somewhat underpowered, so it's not ideal for large yards
Line feed is known to malfunction
Mixed experience on how long the battery life lasts per charge

website_summaries.verdict: With a 24-volt battery, this cordless edger trims and edges for up to 60 minutes or 1/4 acre yard run time.
pros: Adjusts easily from trimmer to edger
Pivoting head adjusts for edging and trimming
Edging wheel helps keep tool in place for borders and curb cleanup
Electric start with 2 ampere hour battery, which is compatible with other Greenworks power tools.12-inch cut path
Auto feed advances line as needed
cons: Auto feed does not advance line as expected

customer_reviews.title: Decent Power, Faulty Design
customer_reviews.text: This string trimmer is relatively strong, which is why I gave it two stars. I knocked off three stars for: 1) the loose lower handle (can't tighten further but constantly falls off), 2) having to frequently turn it off and upside down to manually pull the string out while repeatedly clicking the feed button, and 3) it takes a lot of pressure to keep the handle depressed while using, so it makes my hands ache terribly for days after a single trimming session. I wouldn't repurchase, and do not recommend this trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: R.P. Sands

customer_reviews.title: Life is too short to deal with these problems!
customer_reviews.text: First off-I’m returning this thing. I have battery operated everything for yard tools, including my lawn mower. I was looking forward to the features they boast about. However, nothing and I mean nothing about the string assembly makes sense. It’s frustrating and I really dont want to spend half my day clicking the power on and off to advance the string a 1/4”! Especially since it’s a weak, thin string to begin with. It wears down so fast that it is pointless to try to trim and edge. I have a small yard and gave up halfway through. My old 12V Black and Decker ran circles around this thing. Seriously, dont buy it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: this Green Works electric trimmer is light and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a gas operated one. It was heavy and my arms hurt when done using it. Well, this Green Works electric trimmer is light and easy to maneuver. Power lasts about an hour. I may get an extra battery to switch out after that first hour. We have a half acre so there is plenty to whack!
customer_reviews.author: girlimpressed

customer_reviews.title: I love having no wire or plug
customer_reviews.text: I love having no wire or plug, and being able to walk around the yard with no interference. It is also easy to put together, and easy to use. I have been using it now for 2 months with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Shanu Srivastava

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and functional. A+ purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Love how lightweight this is. At 5’1” tall, it can be hard for me to use some lawn equipment, but I have no problem with this trimmer. It is sturdy but light, does the job well and is easy to use. The string is easy to pull out, too. The battery lasts about 25 minutes and charges pretty quickly, too. I also have a lawnmower from this company which I love and is the reason I purchased the trimmer too.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Weed eater is simple, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a weed eater that was light weight & one I could start. My husband had a Stihl that I could neither start nor use very long because of the weight. Now that he is disabled, I had to have tools I could use. I've only had it a short time, but used it enough to be very happy with it. It meets my criteria, & the battery charges quickly. I feel like this is uncomplicated so that I can figure out most problems. I'll need to see over time if it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: KMV

customer_reviews.title: First-Rate
customer_reviews.text: I needed a low-budget weed-whacker, and this is the one that people kept talking about. So I bought it. It has been exceptional. The lithium-ion battery charged quickly; the weed-whacker itself was a quick assemble, with good instructions (not that you actually need any), and has a few new features (e.g. automatic line extension, though with a manual override for control-freaks like me). It works as well as any of the three previous two-cycle gasoline weed-whackers I've previously owned in my life. The battery was only down by 30 minutes of charge after 40 solid minutes of some seriously-delayed whacking. I'm very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Never Drag a Cord Around Again!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long... I've had an electric string trimmer for awhile now, and put up with dragging the cord around with me everywhere... If I had known how much easier it is to do my lawn trimming with this thing, I never would have bought the corded one at all. I have a fairly large lawn, with lots of trimming to do, around gardens etc, and the battery has never run out on me. Also, the 24v model is plenty powerful enough to use for most normal lawn trimming.
customer_reviews.author: George Sawyn

customer_reviews.title: SMALL BUT CAPABLE
customer_reviews.text: So far, this little trimmer has worked great. I used it to replace a gas trimmer I had on a 2 acre lot. I've gone "around" twice, so far, on one charge. It appears to be able to do everything I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: GFenster

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it twice so far and If there wasn’t a restocking fee I would probably return it. Auto feed doesn’t work. 15 minutes of battery life followed by a couple hours charge. Not heavy but not light. Awkward to hold onto at first. I guess if I’m going to keep it I’m going to order a second battery so I can try to get my property done in the same day without waiting for a battery to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEM SOLVER
customer_reviews.text: LOVE my new unit! SOLVED my issues of having to start a gas powered unit up, which I always seem to have. Admittedly, I only have a few areas where I need a trimmer, so for me, a battery powered unit works superbly well. Battery life is very poor, (per charge), and only lasts about 20 minutes on a full charge. If you have much more than 20 minutes worth of trimming to do, then this unit isn't for you; unless you don't mind taking a break while the battery is recharging. PERFECT unit for older adults who can't hold a heavy unit. VERY LIGHTWEIGHT!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I did all the weed eating I wanted done, and still had plenty of battery.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerDon Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Tesla of weed whackers!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I was needing a whacker as my yard was getting bad. Looked at some gas ones but they were so expensive and I didn’t want to deal with the maintenance of them. I found this guy and when I got it in, I went to work with it. It’s wonderful! It gets the job done and it’s lightweight, easy to assemble and has tremendous power.
customer_reviews.author: Brenden

customer_reviews.title: A Great 24v toy in the arsenal.
customer_reviews.text: Have the 6.5" circular saw, and extend-a-pole shrub trimmer. Both lead me to get this. Works Very well, my needs didn't dent battery life. Neither did my use of the shrub trimmer. Loved not having to tow a cord or step ladder. Used the circular for a simple project - no cord a bonus. But, I wouldn't ever try tasking it with very much pressure treated 2x4.. Already burned 3 corded 7" building decks, Way above this unit - realize its' limits. The Greenworks 24V series is Great for lighter duty tools. Very well built, quality performance.
customer_reviews.author: CustomSarge

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t auto feed, even though it says it does.
customer_reviews.text: This unit says it’s auto feed and if it doesn’t automatically auto feed, it will feed when you turn the unit off and back on. Well this never auto feeds! I had to flip the unit over and manually extend the cord. Definitely returning this!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!!
customer_reviews.text: The auto feed feature on the String spool does NOT work. At all! Had to manually adjust the string every few minutes. The battery holds a very low charge. The unit can be used for a few minutes, then the battery has to be charged. The cycle repeats over and over, totally wasting our time. Once assembled, the unit can not be disassembled. The manufacturer sure made it impossible to return this defective, poorly made, string trimmer. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl H

customer_reviews.title: Fed a Line!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer a year ago. I have used it about twenty-five times to trim a residential yard. The auto fed does not advance the trim cord. I must constantly stop trimming to take the cover off the trim spool and advance the cord manually. The cord disappears each time and must be rethreaded though a eye hole. I am disappointed. The instructions say it will auto advance each time it is turned off and on. Not so.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B

customer_reviews.title: Terrible purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the worst purchases I’ve made. The trimmer didn’t work properly from the start. The line broke constantly and the line would never advance as claimed. It finally failed completely. Greenworks would not back their product after repeated calls. Their warranty for a this defective part was for me to drive 50 miles to a shop to repair it. Ridiculous! It needed to be replaced entirely. I purchased the trimmer in May 2018 but it was manufactured in 2015 so I believe they dumped old merchandise on Amazon that they then refused to stand behind. Cannot recommend this company’s products.Buyer beware! I would rate this NO STARS if I could!
customer_reviews.author: JMina

customer_reviews.title: Don’t purchase this product if you live in the country and have some hearty weeds to knock down.
customer_reviews.text: Weed eater does not live up to what I thought it would by the description. I am going to send it back. First battery operated item I have send back to Amazon. I love the Greenworks cordless blower, hedge trimmers. This just doesn’t measure up to the other two products. Reviews mislead me.😤
customer_reviews.author: wanda brooks

customer_reviews.title: The trimmer worked great for the short time I was able to use ...
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer worked great for the short time I was able to use it. The battery life was less time that I was expecting around 5 to 8 min with a full charge. The battery and battery charger don’t look like the one in the picture the one that I got is black and it looks like maybe is an old model probably that’s why the battery is not properly holding charge.
customer_reviews.author: FatChupacabras

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: I needed a simpler solution for tidying up my lawn because I hate gas trimmers and corded ones are annoying. This is a great solution and not even very expensive. The battery provides enough power to do my back yard and the HOA does the front so it works out. Charging is fast, the unit is lightweight and very versatile. People gives unfair reviews about the product but fail to recognize the good performance in it. Good battery power, acceptable line feed, versatile design to do different trimming tasks and overall good design. I like mine alot. Plus, they're not expensive and it’s powerful enough to tackle heavy grassy areas.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Used the first time and was glad it worked. Used the second time and battery ran down a bit sooner. Used the third time and battery lasted about 5 minutes of running. This time, battery is supposedly charged; lasted about 5 minutes; charged again. Says it's charged. Won't turn on. If it does start, when it hits any grass, the power drops drastically, then stops completely. Going to try to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, with one early hiccup.
customer_reviews.text: My charger initially reported the battery charged when it was not, which led to the motor sputtering out after a short period of use, like others who complained and returned theirs. Called Greenworks support, who were very helpful. Charged battery to full, no issues in operation, and have not had the false charge reporting since. Using the battery charge indicator on the battery itself instead of the charger can help to diagnose the issue, for others who may encounter it. The trimmer works great as a trimmer, and the line is easy to replace.
customer_reviews.author: Beef Rocksteak

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use and light to work with
customer_reviews.text: Very quick and easy to use. I haven't timed it exactly, but the battery lasts long enough for me to do everything I need to do around my 3 acre property in 2-3 charges (it does charge very quickly, about an hour or so). It's great though, no gas to mix, no trouble starting, just pop in the battery and go to town!
customer_reviews.author: Draggon

customer_reviews.title: but its fine around the house
customer_reviews.text: Working so far. As expecting for the price. Wont be clearing brush, but its fine around the house. Just have to make sure the battery is seated correctly, it can be a little deceiving. It if runs for a second or two then quits push the battery in.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened
customer_reviews.text: After reading some of the poor reviews I attributed some of them to maybe not so mechanical - my mistake, this unit is light weight and does a good job (when it works right) but after 30 minutes of use I had to stop seven times to take the reel feed apart and get it to feed correctly - (I even rewound half the spool so it wouldn't tangle). The rotating head was a plus - but now it is stuck in the detent and won't lock into position anymore. I can take it apart I'm sure and fix it - but this is not what I was expecting to have to happen.
customer_reviews.author: Gary H.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: My first purchase and use of a rechargeable lawn tool and I LOVE it! This bad boy has lots of giddy up and go, made lawn work kind of fun, and I have never been a yard work type of person. This thing brought great joy watching it totally obliterate those pesky weeds the mower cannot reach. Love it so much now I am waiting for my Greenworks rechargeable hedge trimmers to arrive. Looking forward to getting creative with the overgrown shrubbery next.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for one summer.
customer_reviews.text: As others have reported the string on this trimmer stops feeding. I carefully rewrapped spool and it worked fine for one usage. Then I had to rewrap spool again at next usage. Whenever I turn the unit off spool stops feeding. Definitely a design fault. Even tried a new spool factory fresh and auto feed failed. So disappointing being that mower, blower, pole saw, and chain saw are all by GreenWorks and work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cali-kaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I begged my husband for months to get me a battery weed eater/ edger because our gas one is too heavy for me to hold for long. This little thing is great for me! The battery will last long enough to go around our back fence, swingset, front flowerbeds, and edge the driveway without dying. My only complaint is that the line seems pretty thin and I haven't had the best luck with the autofeed feautre, but it's not a deal-breaker for me because the yard gets done and my husband doesn't have to wear himself out after work to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed and wanted
customer_reviews.text: I use this to trim the lawn and small weeds around the yard and driveway. I have not used it on heavy duty weeds. It does what I need, it is easy to use, and it is super lightweight. I have not had an issue with the battery life being too short. Sometimes the automatic feeder doesn't work, but it's so light and easy to manually feed that I don't think it's even worth complaining about.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2 seasons
customer_reviews.text: Well, mine worked great until it didn't. All of a sudden it would stop whipping 15 seconds after it started. I would take it apart, but it back together and it would work again for a few mins, then would quit again. Battery was fully charged. Then I found that after it would stop if I waited about 5 seconds I could re-start it and get it going again, until that didn't work and it just become useless. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the battery does not last one season junk dont buy it
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought it was going to be alright for what we had to trim but we used it about four or five times last summer when it arrived and I stored the battery in a box during the winter only to bring it out and charge it for this season and the battery is dead and wont take a charge $70.++ dollars for a piece of junk. So that is my review,
customer_reviews.author: AAABUTCH

customer_reviews.title: I like Greenworks but this product isn't holding up
customer_reviews.text: It cuts well when the line is out but the auto-feed is not working on this product. I have checked the line and it is not tangled. Not sure what is going on. It is very annoying having to flip it around and push the button to get more line. I am using the prestrung line provided by Greenworks. I have 2 batteries and it will drain both in order to finish cutting around my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, but battery runs down
customer_reviews.text: While I like the weight and it's easy to use, I'm disappointed the battery runs down quickly when not plugged into the charger. Would prefer not to keep the battery plugged in 24/7. I even tried removing the battery from the charger after it was charged and did not put it back into the trimmer. Next time I used it, the battery was dead.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: worked fine for a few usages. manufacturer is ignoring me
customer_reviews.text: i bought this late July 2019. i used it 3 times. when it worked, it did a decent job. nice and light. the string feed issue others complain about didn't really bother me. what does bother me is that after only 3 uses the battery will not charge. not sure if its the battery or the charger. i used the contact form on the companies website, but they will not respond. so i now have a $100 paperweight. lucky me.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Nice battery powered weed whacker
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace an old craftsman weed whacker (actually just the battery but the battery is almost as expensive as a whole new tool so here we are). Saw this a deal of the day so decided to purchase. This is a really nice tool, very versatile, for the small area I need to cover. Its lite and easy to use. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Power and battery life are ok, auto feed never worked.
customer_reviews.text: The battery life was sufficient for me to do most of what I needed around my home on one charge. It is a fairy lightweight unit compared to a gas powered trimmer. The big problem is that the auto feed has never worked. Any time I need to advance the string I need to turn the unit over and advance it manually. Yes, I followed all the instructions in the manual and it doesn’t feed automatically or when I start and stop the trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J

customer_reviews.title: Trimmer battery issues
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this trimmer for the first 4 - 5 times that I used it. The product is strong, light weight, and the trimmer string feed system works well. However, the battery life on the item has been declining rapidly between the first and approximate 12 use. The first time, the battery lasted 40 minutes. After a dozen uses, the battery life is down to approximately 10 minutes. In addition, there is a problem with the safety interlock that prevents the trimmer from turning on all the time. I think that this trimmer will die fairly soon. I will call customer service to see how they will fix this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: 25 mins battery life if you're lucky
customer_reviews.text: Bsttery life sucks! I'm on day 2 of attempting to finish my lawn...literally waiting for a partial recharge to go out for the 3rd time. 25 mins tops is the battery life. Looks like I'll need a $50 backup battery. Disappointed but determined to complete the task.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: A little light and touchy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it does what it's supposed to. The line is light, so it has a tough time on big weeds, and every now and then it beeps and is slow to start. For light trimming of a well kept lawn, it's perfect. For my mess of a "lawn" (no real grass yet), it struggles. More my fault than the machine's. Maybe next year.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Handy for small, quick jobs.
customer_reviews.text: We have a gas trimmer that was always difficult to start and handle. This model is light and easy to use for light trimming. Not sure how it would work on a large heavy lot of weeds, but we only wanted it for trimming the grass at the edges. There is an "edger" capability, but we use our gas edger for the heavy-duty task.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hammond

customer_reviews.title: What a Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer was super when it worked. After using for two months, it stopped working. It appears the battery isn't charged, but it's fully charged. I've been trying to reach Greenworks since April, 2020. They responded to an email saying they were experiencing difficulty getting back to customers due to COVID19. I've been patient, looked at their youtube videos and done some online research on the problem with no luck. If I call the help line number, the wait is forever and the response to emails is automated. I think I'd enjoy the trimmer, but when a company doesn't stand behind a product, I'm gone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to assemble, does not make my arms vibrate after using it. Love the battery operated idea, gave my old weedwacker (electric) away, free to good home. I have almost .5 acre and one juiced battery gets me thru anything I want to wack. So glad I bought this. See my review re/two speed GW blower, you will not be disappointed in that, either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after much window shopping and research. It was a father's day gift for my husband, to replace our old electric one. So far, he loves this and has had no issues! It was affordable, it's sturdy, and gets the job done very well! No gas, no short cord to contend with. A really good trimmer and it gets those thicker, tall weeds in no time. For this quality, the price is unreal for everything that you are getting!
customer_reviews.author: Geekfamily2008

customer_reviews.title: Really excellent quality, with well thought out features
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily because it was the same price as a battery and charger. That's right, if you need a spare battery you can get the trimmer free, or choose instead a blower. I chose this because it had very good review. After I assembled it I tried it and found that it did a great job. Most of the weight is in the motor end. unlike a gasoline one. The cutting line is metal wrapped and cuts extremely well. No gas and almost no noise. I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Aardvark (fka Dalesky)

customer_reviews.title: Buy an extra battery
customer_reviews.text: I like that the head can be adjusted at 90 degrees so that you have an instant edger. It’s fairly powerful, it’s light enough for my 100lb. 16 year old daughter to use, and adjusting the head is easy as a button push and a twist. I had to give it 3 stars because the battery life was surprisingly short. I would suggest buying at least one extra battery if you want to finish once you get started.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Moon Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I’m 76 and had find it much lighter and as powerful as my 40 v black and decker. Also charging is way easier! Buy it! You will be happy. Only challenge was installing the guard. Finally figured it out. Put on cover first, then just push guard around head and turn counter clockwise to lock.
customer_reviews.author: juicevicki

customer_reviews.title: Line Feed Problem
customer_reviews.text: Bad design on line feed. Just does not work, others have reported also, wish I had paid attention to them.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: RIPOFF!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this out of box partly put together but missing a nut to hold screw in plus a screw missing from handle. Called help number listed all I got was was recordings over and over for special offers. From an alert system case I fall to offer to win $300 gift card to use almost anywhere. Never got to ask anything. PL ASE don't buy anything from greenworks!!! Pure junk!!!! I know I have this one and several friends looking for the missing nut and screw for me in spare parts etc they have. RIPOFF! Can't even talk to them! LOWSY customer serv cause it doesn't exist!!!?!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica McCue

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Greenworks trimer I have owned. Great when it works. The first lasted two years the second one year. I am looking for a different make. I do not cut brush or tall grass. The first has motor issues once it gets used for 5-7 minutes. The second was great until today when the battery does not seat or the on switch is defective. One year is not a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Leroy W. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I just gave this an innaural run ~ and this is awesome. The battery charged REALLY fast. Easy to assemble. We have a very steep hill that grass & weeds have grown up through our planting’s. I decided this year that I just couldn’t deal with our old corded weed wacker. Even though it had rained most of the day, I decided to test it out. Great power. Easy to operate. The wet grass didn’t clog things up. Not too heavy to maneuver. I got everything done in about 7 minutes which would have taken at least 30-45 minutes with my old corded one. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Susie Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage to use; spool is not autofeed
customer_reviews.text: I don’t usually write reviews, but this trimmer is so bad I had to come tell people not to buy it. The “auto feed” on the line is non-existent. After weed eating for about 5 minutes you have to stop and manually adjust the spool to be able to use it. I’ve ran 4 lines of spool through it and each one was the same. Very frustrating to use. I finally just threw mine in the trash and will be shopping for one I can actually use.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Shaver

customer_reviews.title: NO AUTO FEED FOR LINE!
customer_reviews.text: NO AUTO FEED FOR THE LINE! This is an out right lie. It feeds 1/8” every time you start and stop the unit. You have to manually turn the machine upside down and hand pull the line. This is a royal pain in the butt vs. gas models that tap on the ground and out comes the line. I would not buy again until this gets fixed. And to make it worse, you don’t really know the issue until you have used the unit and then can’t return it.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Strollo

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work well for me
customer_reviews.text: Unless I’m doing something wrong, this thing really doesn’t work so well. I was really disappointed. I attempted to trim down my hostas and it wasn’t even cutting through those thin leaves, just flattening them. I only used once as I recieved it the beginnings of the fall season. I’ll give it another try in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: G. H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this, it won’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase this! It is impossible to put together and once you do you realize how cheap it is because it falls apart and the two major pieces won’t connect! I had to glue it together because they would not take a return and they have no way to complain because they do not honor quality. Amazon should not allow this to be sold!
customer_reviews.author: Kerry Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Not like a normal weed eater, it was missing the guard and you have to stop the whole thing to release the wire. Like there is a button that you have to press at the end where it sounds to release the wire. Battery doesn't really last long. Not a terrible product, but could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Good for 1 summer.  Then that’s it.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 4 1/2 months. After that, the trimmer would go dead after 5 minutes use. The battery would still show a charge, but it would die halfway thru my yard. I could pop the battery out and back in, and sometimes it would start back up, but sometimes not. A hassle for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chad T Riggins

customer_reviews.title: review
customer_reviews.text: I used it for 5 minutes before wheel broke off. String keeps getting wrapped around moter and getting stuck.
customer_reviews.author: claude w senecal

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last more than 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: No matter how long I charge the battery for, and even when it shows as fully charged, the unit only lasts 10 minutes maximum. When i go to recharge the battery, it takes 4 hours to achieve full charge. So in order to do my lawn, which required a minimum 30 minutes to edge and trim the weeds, it is a 12 hour ordeal. Highly disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: koolmets21

customer_reviews.title: Bad feeder design
customer_reviews.text: The feeder design is horrible and does not work great. I read the articles and the problem does not get addressed. I wish it had a numb release or something better that what it has.
customer_reviews.author: Home

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It did what i needed it to do but the battery life is not that great. I used mine for about 30 mins and the charge was down to one bar. for small areas it is great but for long term use it is not great unless you have more than one battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mixted

customer_reviews.title: Works much better than my last battery-powered trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Greenworks 12-Inch 24V Cordless String Trimmer for enough of Florida's long mowing season to recommend it for ease of use, durabilit, portability, and battery longevity. If you pick one up, don't forget to protect your purchase with an inexpensive extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Battery dies rather quickly. U will have to work fast. Also get another battery to complete yard work quicker. It comes with 2 spools & 2 spool covers. No need to buy extra spools. Also the Trimmer string seems to be rather durable.
customer_reviews.author: JaeJae

customer_reviews.title: Great device but the battery is weak
customer_reviews.text: Charging the battery is a problem. Once fully charged it only last under 30 minutes cutting my yard. This poses a problem. The Green Works company needs to fix this problem. My yard is not very large but when we have to stop and recharge, wait 2 hours and then after 15-30 minutes of using the trimmer, we have to stop and recharge again and wait another 2 hours. This is a big problem
customer_reviews.author: Dr. M. Tina Dupree

customer_reviews.title: Perfect trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Part of a bundle, very reasonably priced. I was worried price would mean lesser power, but they are both powerful and do a great job. I have a large yard and it made trimming, edging and cleaning up much easier. I probably would buy an extra battery as just one included in my bundle. Charges fast and lasts. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Almost but NOT QUITE what they advertised
customer_reviews.text: automatic string feed was not automatic,you have to turn it over physically ,and pull it out as you push the button. Far from automatic. The battery lasted long enough to do one side of my drive,,, 15 minutes total including self auto feeding and all.The string is way thin and it doesn't last , sending you back automatically. Huge waste of effort for little gain
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Mull

customer_reviews.title: Not enough life
customer_reviews.text: No auto feed and battery life is really poor after 6-10 charges. I have many weeds and need something that will last more than 30 minutes. I also spent too much time trying to replace string. I have used this product maybe 10 times and it works with low power with a fully charged battery and sounds like it’s about to shut off.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Button malfuntion
customer_reviews.text: Button on head of unit stopped working after very first use. It would not lock the head, causing the unit to be completely useless. Custermer service was great at greenworks. Patience is key. the process has taken several weeks to resolve and is still on going for me. New model sent to me was made better (10 inch model), with manual (no spring) button/twist switching mode from edging to weed whack modes.
customer_reviews.author: nonnie

customer_reviews.title: Battery life poor
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in battery life of this product. Should at a minimum last 2 years . Had to go back to Greenworks to see now if they will honor two year warranty on the battery. If they do not honor battery warranty they I do not plan to replace or purchase another green works product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Palella

customer_reviews.title: Charge don't last long enough!
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is too short, unable to finish the yard with one charge. I do what can be done on one charge and put it back to charge up while I cut the yard and it still isn't ready to use to complete edging the around house. Come back next day to complete the yard. Need two chargers for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa D. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Here's what I like: this weed-whacker works fine for our small yard. Not very powerful but doesn't need to be. It's light-weight and best of all, no cord to worry about! What I don't like: the battery only lasts 45 minutes-1 hour, tops. And it's a little bit of a pain having to hold two buttons while you work.
customer_reviews.author: Judecat

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This trimmer gets the job done. Love the wheel for edging. Helps keep you the correct distance from the ground and in line. Battery life allows me to complete my yard in with one charge. The line spool is easy to replace and adjust if needed. Highly satisfied with the product. Would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a trimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Gift for the kids. They sent a pic of it doing a great job.
customer_reviews.text: Holds a good charge. Nicely priced, does the job! Only knock is it isn't auto-feed. However, the video claims it is autofed by the click of the trigger. Maybe I need to head across country to see just what in the Sam H. is going on. I like how you can adjust it vertically. It's a 5-star unit. No gas fumes, no mess. It's good looking and tough. Doesn't it look snazzy?
customer_reviews.author: Smile,Happiness & Love

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Works better than anticipated for a battery powered tool. I love the adjustments... So my son can use it comfortably (he's a short almost 7y old). I can use it for long periods of time. I've actually returned 1 to homedepot because it was just too much for my to hold onto and work efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once so far but it is great. Lightweight. Easy to put together. Battery charged fast and lasted the whole time I was working, well over an hour. Came with an extra spool of whip thread.
customer_reviews.author: JosephO

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: Really wished I had gotten all of my Greenworks products sooner. Lighter and easier to use than my old electric cord weedwacker. It covers my average size yard with one charge (at least 30 minutes) and recharges within an hour or so. Very strong wacking and edging with long lasting cord-reel system. No more stopping to coax out or fix more cord. It's completely automatic. Haven't had to change it out yet, could last another season before swapping out the cord cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Free Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It’s an okay weed trimmer, hard to maneuver in tough spots and has a single string, so it doesn’t cut as well as those with two. The string provided with purchase gets tangled easily and the auto feeder doesn’t work that great. I’d suggest a different model, but going electric is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this trimmer because I needed one and I already own G24 batteries from my Greenworks drill and impact driver. Used this about five times already and so far, no issues whatsoever. A fully charged battery lasts as advertised, and I didn't have any issues seating them either. It's lighter, doesn't make a lot of noise, and just overall easier to use than the gas trimmer that I keep borrowing from my uncle.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I really like this cordless machine! The battery life is about 15-20 minutes, so I wish I had bought an extra battery. it is lightweight and the cord feed is functional, I like being able to adjust the height too.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie1

customer_reviews.title: So, So
customer_reviews.text: It would be great for light weeds but not for thicker ones. I get about 10’ before the battery dies. I called the company but without the model number they won’t help me. She kept saying that it was on the weed eater. I don’t care for it. Plus you have pull the feed every 2 minutes. It’s not a bump feed. Pain in the behind.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: GREENWORKS TRIMMER
customer_reviews.text: WORKS GREAT........DOES A GOOD JOB AT TRIMMING......DONT LIKE LOW BATTERY LIFE, BUT CHARGES FAST..SHOULD HAVE COME WITH 2 BATTERYS, THOU....THE STOOL KEEPS GETTING STUCK.....SO THATS A PAIN IF YOU WIND YOUR OWN STRING...WILL TRY BUYING THEM ALREADY DONE, MAY WORK BETTER...IT USES .65 STRING.......I AM A WOMEN, IN MY 70S........
customer_reviews.author: maliha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this along with a Greenworks mower when we ditched our yard service this Spring. Very happy with the edger. Battery has always lasted for as long as we need it to, with quick recharge. Powerful performer.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works great - easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Very good edger - I choose this brand because of the positive experience we've had with Greenworks, and we're not disappointed. Just make sure you get it together properly, as without the guard in place it won't turn on. Works great, easy to handle,very good price.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: bail line has to be released manually..
customer_reviews.text: Love it light weight, don't like that the bail line does not release automatically , have to hand release it .. but I can use it without worrying about gas mix, or electric cable. great for the yard and removing weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very light
customer_reviews.text: Good product except the line. The string trimmer line has to be manually pulled out. Looking for another trimmer head that will work so can just tap on ground. But other than than, good product
customer_reviews.author: A. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap battery operated lawn trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Had Lowe's brand trimmer. Battery died after 2 years. Replacement battery was $90. This trimmer, 2 years ago, was $90. Decided to skip Lowe's and go with this one. Never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Tertoo

customer_reviews.title: NOT a good edger
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a trimmer, BUT not as an edger. The "AUTO" line feed is nowhere to be found (must press a button to let out line). Besides (and what is worse), when edging along a sidewalk, the concrete will eat up the line almost instantly. Would NOT recommend as an edger.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L Pujol

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my need
customer_reviews.text: Only used this once so far, but was very happy. It was relatively easy to assemble. The battery charge lasted me about as long as I needed. I felt it was very easy to use and to switch from a weed-wacker to an edger. For what I paid for this, compared to other products, I am happy as it perfectly met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this!
customer_reviews.text: Did not last a year. Used it last season and it made it through the summer, but the battery life is terrible. Also the auto line feed most of the time doesn't work. When it does it extends too often since it extends every time you push the power button. How dumb is that? Don't waste your money on this
customer_reviews.author: soflatechie

customer_reviews.title: Won't buy this again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used it two times for about a half hour each time, that is about how long the battery charge lasted. The third time it quit would not work at all. The battery had a 24 hour charge. I emailed Greenworks and they did not even respond. Right now I have a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Bon Temps

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great for someone who has some small areas to edge (I use it on our farm to edge around the house). It is lightweight thankfully because our gas powered one I cannot lift and use. The battery lasts about 1 hour on a charge. I wished it would auto fill the string, that is the only problem with it
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda C.

customer_reviews.title: Loving this trimmer! It's quite powerful for such a ...
customer_reviews.text: Loving this trimmer! It's quite powerful for such a small unit and works well. I do wish the guard was a little larger. One hint: Wear eye protection. This thing flings dirt everywhere due to it's power.
customer_reviews.author: RevJoel

customer_reviews.title: Read the details
customer_reviews.text: Nice little trimmer. Needs reengineer of the spool feed. Almost impossible to feed. They’re making what should be simple , difficult Returning unit Additionally, once the 2 piece shaft is assembled forget about uncoupling to store as it comes in the box. Shaft will not separate.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Keown

customer_reviews.title: I love this trimmer!
customer_reviews.text: I'm only 5'3" and this is very easy for me to use, both in height adjustment and how light it is. Hard to rate battery life because I love using this trimmer and can easily lose track of time with the ease of use. Very versatile with all of the different head positions that go from trimmer to edger with the push of a button.
customer_reviews.author: BarbieD

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: This is a grass/weed trimmer....Compared to another brand I had that I left at my mom's home I am not impressed.... It is a lot heavier than the other previous brand I had.....battery life not so great and the supposed auto feeder does not work and I have to feed the string manually all the time! I will contact the company....Unhappy!
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Mermell

customer_reviews.title: Weedeater
customer_reviews.text: This weedeater works great for light weight area's. I use it around my mailbox. Don't use it around chicken netting wire, will chew it up. I would recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: No auto feed feature!
customer_reviews.text: While I love e this trimmer due to the versatility and light weight of it. The seller falsely advertises the fact it is an auto feed line. Please note, it is NOT auto feed. So I have to flip mine upside down and adjust my line every so often. Makes it a true pain to deal with and overlooks the rest of the positives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value, and does exactly what it's intended to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great value, and does exactly what it's intended to do. Yes, advancing the line manually isn't the best, but I didn't need to do that once for a medium sized yard in Chicago. The line is durable, and I did my entire yard without advancing the line. Will update in the coming weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wedig

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 or 6 uses
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of garbage, stopped working after only 5 or 6 uses, contacted Greenworks directly and they asked for some information which I supplied them with, now here we are 3 plus weeks later and nothing. I'll chalk this up as a $70 mistake and buy a reliable trimmer. Horrible job Greenworks, horrible!
customer_reviews.author: mike blievernicht

customer_reviews.title: Time Saver!
customer_reviews.text: My Lord! I don't know why I didn't purchase one of these years ago. I could never get the gas edger started so I have been edging with hand clippers for years. This wonder has cut my edging time from six hours a week to about 30 mintues. No more sore hands!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

product_meta.title: Greenworks 12-Inch 24V Cordless String Trimmer/Edger, 2.0 AH Battery Included 21342
product_meta.description: Style:2Ah Battery and ChargerGreenWorks G-24 System offers versatility with a range of tools to choose from to get the job done with outdoor and indoor tools for all your DIY Projects. Whether it is getting the deck Completed or getting your yard in pristine shape, the G-24 System has a tool for every project. From trimmers, chainsaw, pole saw and sweepers to drills, compressors and handheld circular saws, this system is quickly becoming the most versatile system for the suburban Home. Compatible Battery and Charger Models include, Model 29842 and 29862. GreenWorks 21342 G24 Lithium-ion Cordless 12 inch String Trimmer with 2.0AH Battery and Charger. For best results, your battery tool should be charged in a location where the temperature is more than 45 degree Fahrenheit but less than 104 degree Fahrenheit.
feature_bullets: Pivoting head allows for edging and trimming capability with edging wheel
Electric start eliminates gas hassle, less maintenance and zero fumes; Handle type: Wrap around
12 inch cut path with .065 single line auto feed for easy line advance
Shaft length (inch): 40 inch compatible GreenWorks replacement spool, model 29252 and 29092
Battery and charger included; Compatible battery models 29842 and 29852 and charger 29862; Drive shaft type: Telescoping

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,305 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
